byline.original: By MATT RICHTEL and FERNANDA SANTOS

abstract: Wildfires, once contained to single season, have become year-round threat in some locations in United States and abroad as climate change contributes to hot and dry conditions; runaway fires have increased cost of containment and worsened danger to firefighters and residents; experts differ over how to address situation.
lead_paragraph: Increasingly, fire crews are making calculated decisions to let blazes consume the land, concentrating their efforts on safeguarding communities and watersheds.

headline.main: Wildfires, Once Confined to a Season, Burn Earlier and Longer
headline.print_headline: Fire Season? In Some Spots, It’s Year-Round
